H0.text: The mountain range will become faulted as wind and water erosion change it over time.

H1.text: The mountain range will be lifted up is the statement that best describes how a mountain range changes over time from wind and water erosion.

H2.text: The mountain range will form craters when it changes over time from wind and water erosion.

H3.text: The mountain range will become rounded over time as a result of wind and water erosion.

A4.text: glacial erosion controls the maximum height of mountains, as the relief between mountain peaks and the snow line are generally confined to altitudes less than 1500 m

A5.text: Longer, steeper slopes (especially those without adequate vegetative cover) are more susceptible to very high rates of erosion during heavy rains than shorter, less steep slopes
